pr_title: Enable the configuration YML to be updated by a JSON file

timeline.message:
correcting json parser #743

Signed-off-by: Etienne Lesot <etienne.lesot@rte-france.com>

correcting json parser #743

timeline.bodyText:
I think it would be slightly better to do the same thing as before here:
just call the deserialize() method which will read the json and overwrite the extension
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText:
I think here there will be an issue if you have multiple extensions : the one you get is not necessarily of type E !
Maybe what you can do is use getExtensionByName instead of iterating on all extensions.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

replies.bodyText: Note: you could check this with a unit test with 2 extensions.
replies.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: I suggest to leave the default implementation for those extensions where it's not really useful to implement it, it will save some lines of code :)
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: Maybe for this test we should add a second parameter, like you did in loadflow tests, because here we don't check if other parameters still have their initial value.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: I think it's better to leave the default implementation here.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: As we are in an update operation here (since we have an initial value of parameters, I think it's simpler to call updateExtensions in any case. If there is no extension, it will have the same behaviour anyway.
timeline.author: sylvlecl
sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: Same as for load flow parameters : I think it's simpler to call the "update" event when there is no extension.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: Probably better to leave the default implementation instead.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: Same : I think it's better to leave the default implementation here.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText:
Detail for the assertions:
the first parameter should be the "expected" value, so here it would be more logical to invert the 2 parameters (same for other assertions).
timeline.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: @sylvlecl I agree that this should be the default implementation if we want to prevent breaking the API but isn't it a bit error-prone?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText:
You're right that it's error-prone. I think the options are:

do it this way, and existing extensions will keep behaving as today, BUT new extensions could "forget" to actually implement this
throw an exception as default implementation, but I think it's not a good option since it will compile but fail at runtime
do not implement it, and make it a breaking change, but in that case it's gonna be inconvenient for users

Maybe the best option is to keep the current approach but insist in javadoc that the method must be implemented for updates to work correctly ?
replies.author: sylvlecl

replies.bodyText: I added some javadoc to insist on the need to implement the method for the feature to work properly.
replies.author: sylvlecl

replies.bodyText: I agree it should also be documented in the migration guide for people/projects with custom extensions in my opinion.
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: I have added a section in the migration guide !
replies.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText: Since this method is public, you should maybe call Objects.requireNonNull for parameters which must be not null
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: the only method calling this one have already the requirements (non null) and there is no require non null on the method "readExtension" which is similar, maybe requirements can be add to both methods ?
replies.author: EtienneLt

replies.bodyText: Or both methods can be private ?
replies.author: EtienneLt

replies.bodyText: Yes, if this method is only called in updateExtensions, it might be better to keep it private. I think readExtension is public because it is called elsewhere (not in this repository but in another project using powsybl-core) but if Objects.requireNonNull is not called then, it is by mistake I think.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText: I would avoid using french words (even in tests)
timeline.author: MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: I think it can be refactored with readExtensions and readExtension, it looks similar.
timeline.author: MioRtia
